result.execSummary:
The defendant Nigel R Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid Restitution - Civil Judgment - Reduced by any payment made since restitution order.

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Consecutive to: any sentence existing at time of revocation.

miscConds.notes: In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nigel R Schultz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NEJ returned by USPS - Attempted - Not Known - Unable to Forward
JOC returned by USPS - Attempted - Not Known - Unable to Forward

11:11 am case called. Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record by DA Blader. Attorney Selsing concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2.  No statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 90 days WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. Consecutive to any other sentence. If revoked with Huber & GT. No credit for time served. CONDITIONS: $33.34 Restitution. If restitution not paid during term of probation-to be reduced to a civil judgment. GED or HSED during term of probation.  Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

2:48 pm case called. Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Requesting the defendant be allowed to appear by phone - granted by the court
